bibl.title: Letter from [J.H.L. Cumpston?] to Henry Rose Carter, October 12, 1925

div1.p: [Cumpston?] reports that Carter's paper, presented at the Pan-Pacific Congress, has been published.

div1.head: Letter from [J.H.L. Cumpston?] to Henry Rose Carter, October 12, 1925
div1.opener:
C/MR.
COMMONWEALTH OF AUSTRALIA.
___________
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH,
51 SPRING STREET,
MELBOURNE, 12th October, 1925.
Dear Dr. Carter,
div1.p:
Although I could offer many apologies for the
delay which has occurred in forwarding you reprints of
your paper read before the Pan-Pacific Congress, these
apologies would not in any way alter the fact of the delay.
That delay, however, has now come to an end and I am for-
warding you, under separate cover, 20 reprints of your
article.

The Congress Executive allows only 25 reprints
of each paper, and I have taken the extreme liberty, for
which I hope you will pardon me, of retaining five of
these, as this paper is of such immense importance to Aus-
tralia, for the purpose of grounding some of the younger
members of our staff in the aspects of this particular
phase of quarantine work as presented by the foremost
living authority on the subject.

Will you please accept and convey to Miss
Carter my best wishes for a happy Christmas and a very
profitable and enjoyable New Year.
div1.closer:
Yours sincerely, J M Cumpston
Director-General of Health. Surgeon-General H. R. Carter,
2122 Calfornia Street, N.W.,
WASHINGTON. D.C.
